item.title: Rainbow Six Siege Is Finally Getting Full Crossplay
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/rainbow-six-siege-is-finally-getting-full-crossplay/

After nine years, Rainbow Six Siege is finally getting crossplay between PC and Console players. The news was announced as part of the Operation Collision Point reveal on Sunday.

When playing online, players on console will have three different pools to choose from when looking for a match. There will be platform-specific pools to keep you against those on the same system, a consoles-only pool to allow crossplay between PlayStation and Xbox, and a PC crossplay pool. The pool can be set in the general settings under “Crossplay Matchmaking”.

As far as the players are concerned, they’ll be able to invite anyone to a match through Ubisoft Connect. Those on console who decide they want to play with PC players will have a separate PC rank from their traditional console rank for ranked playlists.

With the addition of crossplay between the platforms, the team knows that cheating is a concern. It’s something that the developers have been working on handling before the feature became available.

“We are excited to confirm that MouseTrap V2 will be a part of this feature to keep things balanced,” UX Designer Abhishek Agarwal said.

Creative Director Alexander Karpazis added that the system will allow detection if someone is trying to play with a mouse and keyboard against just console players that will move players to the PC pool if they are detected. Regarding cheating, there is a new “Cheater Match Cancellation” system that will remove a cheater from the game and cancel the entire match if one is detected.

What do you think of Rainbow Six Siege getting full crossplay support? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what game is reportedly next to get the remaster treatment. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 System Requirements. Can You Run It?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/microsoft-flight-simulator-2024-system-requirements-can-you-run-it/

Knowing firsthand whether you can run an upcoming simulator is step number one in immersing yourself in the experience wholly. With a game like Microsoft Flight Simulator 2025, the system requirements determine everything, down to your enjoyment of the game. If your computer can’t run the title, you’ll find it a jarring experience that runs the risk of leading to motion sickness. Thankfully, we have the info you need!

Here’s the Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 PC Requirements

In a simulation game that somehow manages to span the entire planet, albeit in minimal detail in some locations, one would assume the system requirements would be exceptional. They’re pretty high in some spots. Previously, there were rumors that MFS 2024 would require 64 GB of RAM to run on the high-end. However, that doesn’t appear to be the case any longer, as the recommended amount of RAM sits at 32 GB currently.

Minimum Requirements

  • OS: Windows 10 (64-bit)
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 5 2600X / Intel Core i7-6800K
  • Graphics: Radeon RX 5700 / GeForce GTX 970
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 50 GB Available Space (SSD Recommended)
  • Network: Broadband – Network Speed of 10 Mbps Bandwidth

Recommended Requirements

  • OS: Windows 10 (64-bit)
  • Processor: AMD Ryzen 7 2700X / Intel Core i7-10700K
  • Graphics: Radeon RX 5700 XT / GeForce RTX 2080
  • Memory: 32 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 50 GB Available Space (SSD Recommended)
  • Network: Broadband – Network Speed of 50 Mbps Bandwidth

What Platforms is Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Releasing On?

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 will be released on November 19 and immediately available to play on PC and Xbox Series X|S. Unfortunately, the flight simulator that spans the globe isn’t coming to PlayStation 5. There’s no word on whether this might change, but with past Microsoft console-exclusive titles, like Grounded and Sea of Thieves, launching on PS5, it’s not outside the realm of possibility.

Can your system handle Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024? Let us know in the comments below what you’re running, or join the conversation in our community forum to discuss your gaming rig!

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 is one of the many day-one launch titles available for Xbox Game Pass in November, along with plenty more coming for no additional cost to the monthly sub program!

Subscribe to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Airplanes in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 On Launch
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/airplanes-microsoft-flight-simulator-2024/

It’s becoming the norm for an upcoming game to launch with two, three, or sometimes even four unique editions that vary in price and content. The more you spend, the more in-game content you receive. It’s a shame. But if you’re the type of gamer who only plays a handful of titles throughout the year, especially if you have a favorite franchise, paying a little extra for one game makes more sense. Regarding the many airplanes in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, paying for the most expensive edition is how you’ll unlock everything at launch.

Every Airplane in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 on Launch

With four unique game editions to consider, it’s confusing which version of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 is worth your time. Here’s a rundown of every airplane you’ll unlock in each edition of the game:

Standard Edition

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Standard Edition features 65 airplanes and 150 handcrafted airports to explore worldwide.

  • Aero Vodochody L-39
  • Aeroelvira Optica
  • Air Tractor AT-802
  • Airbus A310-300
  • Airbus A320neo
  • Airbus A321LR
  • Airbus A330-200 / 200F / 300
  • Airbus A330-743L Beluga XL
  • Airbus A400M Atlas
  • Airbus Helicopters H125
  • Airship Industries Skyship 600
  • Archer Midnight
  • Aviat Pitts Special S1S
  • Aviat Pitts Special S2S
  • Beechcraft Bonanza G36
  • Beechcraft King Air 350i
  • Bell 407G
  • Boeing 737 MAX 8
  • Boeing 747-8I & 8F
  • Boeing F/A-18E
  • Cessna 152
  • Cessna 172 Skyhawk (GP)
  • Cessna 208 Grand Caravan Ex
  • Cessna 400 Corvalis TT
  • Cessna Citation CJ4
  • CGS Hawk Arrow II
  • Cirrus Vision SF50
  • Cubcrafter NX-Cub
  • Cubcrafter X-Cub
  • Curtiss JN-4 “Jenny”
  • Daher TBM 930
  • De Havilland Canada CL-415
  • De Havilland Canada DHC-2 Beaver
  • De Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter
  • DG Aviation DG 1001E
  • DG Aviation LS-8
  • Diamond DA40 NG
  • Diamond DA62
  • Douglas Aircraft Company DC-3
  • Draco X
  • Erickson S-64 Aircrane
  • Extra E330
  • Fairchild Republic A-10 Thunderbolt II Warthog
  • Flight Design CTSL
  • Grumman G-21A Goose
  • Guimbal Cabri G2
  • Heart Aerospace ES-30
  • Hot Air Balloon N/A
  • Hot Air Balloon Motor FlyDoo
  • Hughes H-4 Hercules “Spruce Goose”
  • Icon A5
  • Jetson Aero Jetson One
  • JMB VL3
  • Joby Aviation S4
  • Magni M-24 Orion
  • MX Aircraft Company MXS-R
  • North American P-51
  • North American T-6 Texan
  • Pilatus PC-6 Porter
  • Pilatus PC-12 NGX
  • Powrachute Sky Rascal
  • Robin CAP 10
  • Robin DR400-100 Cadet
  • Robinson R66
  • Ryan NYP “Spirit of St. Louis”
  • Stemme S12-G
  • Volocopter Volocity
  • Wright Cycle Company Wright Flyer
  • Zivko Aeronautics Edge 540
  • Zlin Aviation Savage Cub

Deluxe Edition

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Deluxe Edition features everything included in the Standard Edition, plus ten additional airplanes and five more handcrafted airports:

  • Amphibian Aerospace Albatross G111/HU
  • Beechcraft Baron G58
  • Cessna 152 Aerobat
  • Cessna 172 (SP)
  • Cessna 188 AGTruck
  • Cessna 404 Titan
  • Cessna 408 SkyCourier
  • Diamond DA40 TDI
  • Diamond DV20
  • Dornier SeaStar

Premium Deluxe Edition

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Premium Deluxe Edition features everything from the two previous versions, along with 25 additional airplanes and ten more handcrafted airports:

  • Airbus Helicopter H225
  • Beechcraft C90 GTX King Air
  • Boeing 747-400 Global Supertanker
  • Boeing 747-400 LCE Dreamlifter
  • Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner
  • Boeing C-17 Globemaster III
  • Boeing CH47D Chinook
  • Cessna Citation Longitude
  • Cirrus Aircraft SR22
  • Pilatus PC-24
  • Pipistrel Taurus M
  • Pipistrel Virus SW 121
  • Saab 340B
  • Zlin Aviation Savage Norden
  • Zlin Aviation Shock Ultra

Aviator Edition

Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Aviator Edition, the most expensive version of the game, features everything above and 30 Microsoft-published Marketplace airplanes from previous entries between 2021 and 2024, including:

  • Aero Ae-45 / Ae-145
  • Antonov An-2
  • Antonov An-225
  • ATR 42-600 / 72-600
  • Beechcraft Bonanza V35
  • Beechcraft Model 17 Staggerwing
  • Beechcraft Model 18 Twin Beech
  • Bell Helicopter 47J Ranger
  • Boeing 307 Stratoliner
  • Boeing 707-320C
  • Cessna 195 Businessliner
  • Cessna 207T
  • Curtiss C-46 Commando
  • De Havilland Canada DHC-4 Caribou
  • Dornier Do J Wal
  • Dornier Do 31
  • Dornier Do X
  • Douglas Aircraft Company & Waco C-47D Skytrain & CG-4A
  • Focke-Wulff 200 Condor
  • Fokker F.VII
  • Ford 4AT Trimotor
  • Granville Gee Bee R2 / Z
  • Junkers F13
  • Junkers JU 52
  • Latécoère 631
  • Mitsubishi Heavy Industries MU-2
  • Saab 17 B
  • Savoia-Marcketti S.55
  • Short SC.7 Skyvan
  • Westland Scout / Wasp

What airplane are you most excited to fly first in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024? Let us know in the comments below, or start a thread in the General Gaming section of the Insider Gaming forums!

Before you head off to prepare for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, don’t forget to check out the biggest video game releases of December 2024!

item.title: Dark Souls 3 Remaster Is In Development, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/dark-souls-3-remaster-is-in-development-its-claimed/

FromSoftware is set to bring back its best-selling Dark Souls game for a new audience. According to a new claim, Dark Souls 3 is getting the remaster treatment from the studio.

The report comes from known leaker “Shpeshal Nick” Nick Baker, who made the reveal during the latest episode of his Xbox Era podcast.

“A lot of people will probably file this under ‘this was obvious’,” he said. “What I have heard is that we are getting a Dark Souls 3 remaster.”

HELP INSIDER GAMING: Take Our 2024 Reader Survey

Baker hinted that he had more information on the remaster, but wasn’t “allowed to pass that on”. One aspect was regarding resolution and framerate that Nick believes “will be more” than the 1080p 60FPS that the original game features.

First released in 2016, Dark Souls 3 is the best-selling Dark Souls game with over 10 million copies sold. As a franchise, Dark Souls has sold over 35 million units since its debut in September 2011. It also helped fully establish the Souls-like genre that a number of games have utilized in recent years like the Nioh series, Lords of the Fallen, and more.

RELATED: Blizzard Shadow Drops Warcraft 1 and 2 Remasters for 30th Anniversary

What do you think of a Dark Souls 3 remaster being in development? Let us know down below, and join the discussion over at the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about what game could be getting a sequel in the near future. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Datamine Reveals Details about Venusaur EX Battle Event
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-tcg-pocket-datamine-venusaur-ex-battle-event/

The latest Pokemon TCG Pocket datamine has revealed new details about a Venusaur EX Battle event scheduled for December 2024. 

A report from The Gamer reveals details about an upcoming battle event for Pokémon TCG Pocket in December. Following a previous leak, the developers appeared to be preparing for a Bulbasaur and Magnemite Event on December 6. The latest information highlights a new battle event for Pokemon TCG Pocket, featuring the Venusaur EX Deck.

Similar to the Lapras EX battle event that players participated in earlier this month, the Venusaur EX battle event will also be introduced in the solo battle mode of Pokémon TCG Pocket. Players can go through a series of decks to earn various first-clear and drop rewards. Refer to the table below to see which decks will be included in the event and the rewards you can earn by defeating them.

In other news, Pokemon TCG Pocket has confirmed that trading is coming to the game in January 2025. Also, here’s how you can get flair for your favourite cards in the game. What are your thoughts on Pokemon TCG Pocket’s Venusaur EX Battle event? Let us know in the comments or our new community forum!

For more from Insider Gaming, read about Roblox adding new parental controls to protect children. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
